info: Rules for Diploma First Year Admissions
description: Maharashtra State Candidature Candidate: First Year Diploma Course shall be as per the approval given by the authority which is competent for giving approval to respective Courses. Online Applications from Candidates for participating in Centralised Admission Process (CAP) are invited by DTE and for Institute Level Quota students, the Application form is invited by the institute. Our institute DTE Code 3274 (Vidyalankar Polytechnic, Mumbai). For Seeking Admission number of seats are CAP SEATS: 80%, INSTITUTE QUOTA: 20%. Note 1: It is mandatory for the candidates to register in Centralised Admission Process (CAP). Note 2: Institute Level seats will be filled by inviting applications from eligible candidates in the Institute. Note 3: Vacant Seats against (CAP) round will be filled by inviting applications from eligible candidates in the Institutes.

info: Eligibility Criteria for Diploma First Year Admissions
description: First Year of Post SSC. 1) Maharashtra State Candidature candidate, Union Territory of Jammu and Kashmir, and Ladakh Migrant Candidature candidates: i) The candidate should be an Indian National. ii) Passed 10th Std./SSC Examination or its equivalent with at least 35% aggregate marks. Note: Other than Maharashtra, state candidates shall be eligible for Institute quota only. 2) NRI/OCI/PIO, Children of Indian workers in the Gulf Countries, Foreign Nationals: i) Passed 10th Std./SSC examination or its equivalent, with at least 35% aggregate marks. ii) Any other criterion declared from time to time by the appropriate authority as defined under the rules.

info: Documents Required for Diploma First Year Admissions
description: For All Students: Seat Acceptance Acknowledgement, Allotment Letter, FC Verification Receipt, Certificate of Indian Nationality of the candidate, SSC (Std 10th) Marksheet, Domicile Certificate (If applicable), HSC (Std 12th) Marksheet (If you have completed HSC), Aadhar Card Xerox, School/College Leaving Certificate, Five Latest Passport Size colored Photograph, All Documents Attested Two Xerox copy Set. For Reserved Category Students: Caste Certificate, Non Creamy Layer, Migration Certificate If Applicable, Gap Certificate (Affidavit on Rs 100/- Stamp Paper), Caste Validity, Student Bank A/C Passbook Xerox. For Those Who have passed Std. 10th from other than Maharashtra State Board: Migration Certificate. If Applicable: Gap Certificate (Affidavit on Rs 100/- Stamp Paper). For Tuition Fee Waiver candidates and EBC Candidate: Income Certificate.

info: Rules for Diploma Direct Second Year Admissions
description: Rules for Direct Second Year Admission to Full Time Diploma Courses in Engineering & Technology for Maharashtra State Candidature Candidate: Passed Higher Secondary School Certificate (HSC) Science or HSC Science with Vocational or HSC Science with Technical or SSC with 2 years ITI/COE Equivalent to 2 years ITI with appropriate specialization. The distribution of Seats available shall be notified on the website before submission of the option Form of Centralized Admission Process. Lateral Entry Seats: 20% of Sanctioned intake, which will be over and above the Sanctioned intake. Distribution of Seats for Admission: HSC Science: 25%, HSC Science with Technical: 25%, HSC Science with Vocational: 25%, SSC with 2 Years ITI with appropriate specialization: 25%. Assignment of Merit number of various courses: The merit list of the eligible candidates shall be prepared on the basis of percentage of aggregate marks obtained at the qualifying examination, Provided that, in case of tie, the relative merit of Candidates shall be resolved in the following order of preference and the methodology as specified: *Higher percentage of marks in the subject Mathematics or SSC, *Higher percentage of marks in the subject Science or SSC, *Higher percentage of marks in the subject English or SSC.

info: Eligibility Criteria for Diploma Direct Second Year Admissions
description: Eligibility Criteria for Direct Second Year Admissions: HSC Science or its Equivalent with English, Maths, Physics and Chemistry / HSC with technical vocational subjects. MCVC/ITI Pass (2 years) can be admitted to the respective branches.

info: Fee Structure for First Year Admission AY 2024-2025
description: Fees applicable for First Year Diploma- 2024-25 as approved by the Fees Fixation Committee (FFC), Maharashtra State. The concessional fee is applicable to OBC/EBC/EWS/ VJ/NT/SBC/ SC/ST students, subject to fulfilment of eligibility Criteria of SW; In case of Non-eligibility or Non-sanction of Free ship / Scholarship from Government Authorities, the student will have to pay full fees as per the fee structure of Regular (IL/ Open) Category students. Payment Mode: 1) Demand Draft/ Pay order- In favor of “VIDYALANKAR POLYTECHNIC”. 2) QR code for Available @VP Account Section. The current approved fees are likely to be revised by the FFC. In such cases, the students may have to pay the difference amount as applicable, if any.

The Admission Regulating Authority, Maharashtra State, will release a notification in all the major newspapers, as well as on the website www.dtemaharashtra.gov.in, immediately after the publication of SSC, Maharashtra Board results. The schedule for diploma admissions to various Government Polytechnics as well as Unaided Polytechnics will be clearly mentioned in it. The candidate has to obtain an application kit containing user ID and password from the identified centers (called Facilitation Centers) and apply online on the website www.dtemaharashtra.gov.in. Detailed counseling regarding the complete admission process will be available in all Facilitation Centers.
The Vidyalankar Polytechnic does not provide hostel facilities. Most of OHU students prefer PG and other accommodations comfortable to them.
